architectural_notes: Public site visibility depends on data stored on the PUBLIC canister; deploying a new version may not sync draft data to the public canister automatically.
known_issues: Public site shows no books because entries on the public canister may be missing or marked unavailable (available=false), indicating draft/public data is out of sync.

existing_features.title: Add an Admin Settings UI section that lets an admin paste a book identifier (title/filename text) and run the new backend re-enable-by-identifier operation, showing a clear success/failure summary and the list of updated/skipped matches.

Fix public catalog visibility by making the public-facing catalog page query only available books (use `getAvailableBooks` via the existing React Query hook), so books marked `available=true` are what appear on the public site.

Apply a consistent visual theme for the new admin settings controls (spacing, typography, button hierarchy, alerts) that matches the existing admin settings page styling and keeps user-facing text in English.

new_feature_requests.summary: Add an admin-only backend method that sets `available=true` for books matching an admin-provided identifier (exact title/filename text match, case-insensitive), and returns a result containing (a) the number of books updated and (b) the list of updated book IDs/titles. The identifier to support immediately is: "CRYPTO BEGINNER'S GUIDE: HOW TO BUY GOLD TOKENS / GLDT AND MORE FROM SCRATCH".

Ensure the backend re-enable-by-identifier operation does not re-list sold-out single-copy books: if a matching book has `singleCopy=true` and there is evidence it has already been sold (ownership/purchase record exists for that book), keep `available=false` for that book and report it as skipped in the returned result.

projectName: Restore public catalog visibility and enable targeted availability re-enable for a specific uploaded book
